intro: Drymonia buscalionii, commonly known as the Florida flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Its showy inflorescence consists of small, pale yellow flowers surrounded by vibrant bracts. Drymonia buscalionii plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
